job_title: Director, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence - Remote (Anywhere US)
job_Description: Director Data Analytics and Business Intelligence        Overview of Position        The Director of Analytics and Business Intelligence role is a leadership position with the skills and experience to build and lead cross functional strategic analytic engagements that significantly contribute to the overall success of Change Healthcare’s Payment Accuracy suite of solutions. They will lead a team of FTE’s and the development, delivery, and management of reporting, analytic innovation, Artificial Intelligence modeling, and solution design. They will work closely with operations, information technology, sales, and account management colleagues to implement, develop, and deliver the analytical and reporting tools necessary to support the Payment Accuracy suite of solutions.        What are the requirements needed for this position?         7+ years working in a healthcare analytics or comparable role.      3+ years’ experience client/external facing role      5+ years’ experience in a people management role           What critical skills are needed for you to consider someone for this position?         Excellent data analysis and interpretation skills      Knowledge and experience with analytics solutions using cloud-based solutions      Rapid critical thinking skills      Exceptional internal/external presentation and verbal communication skills      Expertise in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and some combination of SQL, Tibco Spotfire, Jira, R, Powershell, and/or Python      Demonstrated experience advancing programs by informing and shaping data driven strategy      Ability to lead through ambiguity and complexity to take calculated risks to solve problems, forge new paths for growth, and achieve challenging goals      Outstanding ability to collaborate and partner with customers, other business teams, and senior leadership      Confirmed strategic business leadership with experience identifying, quantifying, and pursuing new opportunities      Ability to work in a dynamic environment with multiple concurrent projects using creativity, flexibility, and organizational skills      Has multi-year experience in working with analytics teams to examine and specify unique solutions and provides proof of ability to work across complex business and technical teams to understand and specify technology solutions linking analytics business needs to operations           What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?         MBA or Masters Degree a plus      Solid foundation of operational, clinical, and financial healthcare knowledge      In-depth knowledge of services management related to the healthcare industry      Understanding CPT codes, DRG codes, HCPCS, Diagnosis codes, and modifier rules and guidelines.      Advanced industry certifications preferred           What are the working conditions and physical requirements of this job?         General office demands/Home office           How much should I expect to travel?         Up to 20% travel requirement      Employees in roles that require travel will need to be able to qualify for a company credit card or be able to use their own personal credit card for travel expenses and submit for reimbursement.           #li-remote     Join our team today where we are creating a better coordinated, increasingly collaborative, and more efficient healthcare system! job_title: Sales Engineer, Application Modernization, Healthcare, Google Cloud
job_Description: Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote and in-office roles. By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:           In-office locations: Atlanta, GA, USA; Nashville, TN, USA.        Remote location(s): Florida, USA; Tennessee, USA.     Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.      Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.      Experience with legacy/modern application development, cloud service delivery and deployment, containers, and associated technologies.      Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role in the healthcare industry, and experience with HIPAA, OSHA, and other regulations.        Preferred qualifications:          Master's degree.      Experience with healthcare data legal regulations (e.g., healthcare/insurance, big data, machine learning/AI).      Experience with software defined networks (e.g., DNS, software load balancers, network authentication, and identity management).      Experience with cloud-native software development methodologies and tools within application development/deployment stages.      Experience in networking, virtualization, open protocols, application acceleration, VPNs and their application to PaaS and IaaS technologies, routing and firewalls, and logging and monitoring of hybrid-cloud workloads.      Experience with developing scalable architectures using API management, microservice frameworks, PaaS, and container orchestration systems.            About the job      When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.       As an Sales Engineer, you will work with technical Sales teams as an enterprise hybrid cloud subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the vision of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners learn the power of Google Cloud, explain technical features, help customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshoot potential roadblocks.      You will join Google’s efforts in modernizing the healthcare industry through the adoption of Google Cloud Platform, and help lead changes that can positively impact patient care, and revamp and improve the experiences of both healthcare workers and those seeking care.       Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.            Responsibilities           Identify and qualify business opportunities, know key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.       Provide in-depth enterprise infrastructure/cloud modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s clients (e.g., product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud).       Guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environments, provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, and identify applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models.       Structure and execute prototyping workshops to show out proposed new architectures, develop best practices, and document key blocking requirements for prioritization with engineering.       Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required.         Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

United States - Tennessee                        Compliance, Risk                        Group Functions                   Job Reference #            251592BR                   City            Nashville                   Job Type            Full Time                   Your role            Do you want to discover innovative solutions to prevent criminals from abusing the financial system? Are you someone who likes to do the right thing? Do you know how to deliver strategic change through independence and objectivity?               We are looking for someone like that who can:                           be familiar with sanctions laws and regulations including OFAC, UN and EU sanctions and other pertinent regulatory guidance in order to assess a broad range of sanctions risks         identify and participate in initiatives to automate customer and check screening processes using artificial intelligence and supervise machine learning and other system changes        coordinate and conduct testing of sanctions securities related controls and recommend changes and/or escalate issues as appropriate         oversee the sanctions securities lists management process; engaging with the Control Room and other users of the Sanctions securities Application Programming Interface (API) feed to ensure accurate and optimal outputs        lead and coordinate special screening related projects, including participation in the annual Sanctions Model Validation review and documentation process and fulfilling regulatory reporting requirements        assist the Regional Head in drafting disclosures and other sanctions relevant notifications related to new program or system rollouts        be proficient at spotting sanctions screening and program control gaps and developing strategic ways to enhance or change existing controls or introduce new controls where appropriate to Regional and Sanctions Head        analyze sanctions direct and indirect legal and reputational risks in relation to vendors, third party relationships and sanctions screening related escalations         conduct/oversee Sanctions Risk Assessments, including data collection, as well as identify, escalate, and resolve data quality related issues arising in screening         ensure proper maintenance of the proprietary watch lists and keywords sanctions list, oversee the maintenance of OFAC-related logs, cases, entries record documentation for Audit, regulatory and supervisory reviews, and maintain departmental procedures                          Your Career Comeback            We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.                   Your team            We are currently seeking a Sanctions Manager for our Nashville team who will be working within the Americas Financial Crime Prevention team. Our role is to assist UBS in the fight against money laundering, fraud, corruption and terrorist financing.              Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.                   Your expertise             4-year college degree or international equivalent       ideally 5+ years’ experience, preferably in Sanctions or AML, with a wealth management, broker dealer, retail and/or private bank, and/or correspondent bank or equivalent experience at a law firm, regulatory agency, financial institution, major consulting firm, government agency, or in law enforcement       a Law degree or Masters in Business Administration or Finance; ideally two+ years' experience working at the Office of Foreign Assets Control at the US Department of Treasury, Bureau of Industry and Security and/or other equivalent roles in a Supranational Organizations (e.g. UN) is an advantage       previous experience managing a team or overseeing sanctions project implementation at a regulatory agency, financial institution, major consulting firm, government agency, or in law enforcement       proficient in interpreting relevant sanctions laws and regulations and have the ability to analyze and prepare in results in Excel, Powerpoint, Visio or other presentation medium        experience handling sensitive information with a high degree of discretion with a focus on the maintenance of client privacy       organized and analytical, with the ability to provide practical solutions and prioritize a diverse workload with multiple deadlines       result-oriented and assertive (you don’t shy away from challenging situations)       detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task and change directions based on business demands                       LI-UBS       UBS-MOGUL       UBS-ACCA                    About us            UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.              With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?                   Join us            At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.              From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?                   Disclaimer / Policy Statements            UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Overview      Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.      Responsibilities      Position Overview (Fully Remote)      Responsible for full lifecycle recruitment to fill assigned positions. This includesdeveloping/maintainingmultiple sourcing networks to build candidate pool, design and implement innovative recruitment strategies, regular interaction with managers and candidates, utilizing an applicant tracking system to track the interviewing, hiring and evaluation process, and negotiation of employment offers. This role will also partner with business leaders to determine upcoming needs for interns during the campus recruiting season. This will include but not limited to working with and building rapport with college and university placement offices for current and future pipeline needs, posting on handshake and various intern job boards to manage applicant flow, etc.      Job Responsibilities      May work with our VMS or third party recruiters and develop professional relationships for contingent labor or difficult to fill positions.      Responsible for the end-to-end recruiting efforts and assist in the creation of our go to market strategy for our annual internship program.      Develops professional relationships with college and university placement offices to increase number of qualified applicants.      Highly service oriented and able to closely and quickly partner and build relationships with client groups and across HR      Shows ability to prioritize and complete a high volume of work.      Promotes and applies defined active sourcing approaches to identify critical workforce      Demonstrates excellent business acumen with the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of the organization successfully within a matrix organization      Demonstrates strong written and oral communication skills, exhibit strong interpersonal skills, creative thinking and excellent writing proficiency. Responsible for documenting all communications and interactions with candidates in applicant tracking system. Tracks candidate status through entire interview process.      Shows excellent organizational skills and realistic attention to detail as well as strong analytical skills      Manages client expectations and guides hiring manager and candidates alike through the recruiting process.      Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Identifies and determines pro-active steps to avoid recurring issues.      Strong ability to develop offers and manage salary expectations including educating hiring managers      Works on various projects as needed i.e. referral program, contingent worker program, etc.      Qualifications      Job Requirements      Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required      3+ years of recruiting experience required, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.      Skills and ability to assess candidates effectively via telephone or face-to-face.      Project management mindset with the ability to work with a variety of jobs.      Time management and organizational skills is a must.      Written and verbal communication skills including public speaking.      Microsoft Office Skills (Word, Excel, Outlook). Job Overview                                         Summary:  Under immediate supervision, performs a variety of standardized laboratory tasks of routine difficulty and related work as required.     Distinguishing Features:  An employee in this class performs a variety of routine assignments such as preparation of biological media (petri dish plates, tubed media, and etc.), laboratory reagents and chemical solution preparation (water blanks, pH standards, acid/base solutions, stains, and etc.), glassware washing, equipment maintenance and readiness, warehouse receiving, specimen receipt and accessioning, and moderate laboratory testing and specimen procedures under minimal supervision all in support of the laboratory. This class differs from that of Public Health Laboratory Technician 1 in that an incumbent of the latter is not responsible for performing moderate laboratory tests. This class differs from that of Public Health Laboratory Technician 3 in that an incumbent of the latter performs more advanced laboratory work and is considered a lead laboratory technician. Maintains professional working relationships with peers and upper management to ensure smooth and effective team operations.                           Establishes and develops constructive and cooperative working relationships with others and maintains them over time.                        Repairing and Maintaining Mechanical Equipment:                          Performs minor repairs on basic equipment used in assigned areas.                           Performs preventative maintenance on basic equipment used in assigned areas.                           Ensures equipment consumables are stocked and replaced as needed.                        Monitor Processes, Materials, or Surroundings:                          Monitors equipment within a specified area to maintain proper functionality.                           Monitors receiving areas for specimens, supplies, vendors and other deliveries. Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards:                          Uses relevant equipment to measure instrument value to comply with standards and report out-of-range findings. Maintains an open dialogue with external customers to ensure effective and efficient communications.                        Operating Vehicles, Mechanized Devices, or Equipment:                          Operates pallet jack and hydraulic lift cart to retrieve and deliver specimens and supplies.                           Operates passenger vehicle to retrieve and deliver mail and supplies. Overview      Frontdoor is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. With services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: American Home Shield, HSA, Landmark and OneGuard, as well as ProConnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and Streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. Frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the U.S. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. The company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. With 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. For details, visit frontdoorhome.com.      ProConnect is an extension of Frontdoor and allows homeowners to request on-demand home repair and maintenance services through our applications. As an independent branch of Frontdoor, ProConnect operates with the flexibility and freedom of a startup, but with the financial stability and backing of a 50 year-old, publicly traded company. As a member of the ProConnect team, you will have a direct impact on the success of our product.      This position is a 100% REMOTE Quality Assurance Engineer role, working in both backend and frontend systems that leverage the latest technologies (Golang, React, Node, Docker, etc). We integrate with multiple backend APIs and 3 rd party services and are building the future of On Demand home services. This is an exciting role with an opportunity to grow and learn with a seasoned leadership team. We value people as our most valuable asset, and work together to ensure an interesting and rewarding career.      Responsibilities        We Are Owners:  As a member of the ProConnect team, our primary responsibility is to identify and solve customer needs as we build and improve the product. We welcome discussions, feedback, and ideas from every individual on the team, regardless of role, tenure, or seniority. We believe that quality is owned by the entire team (not just the QA department). As a Quality Engineer, you have unique experience and expertise to help us identify areas we should consider and focus on, and we welcome your contributions in any setting.        We Are Transparent:  As a quality engineer on the team, you are expected to be an equal contributor to the success and quality of our product, and are empowered to raise issues and concerns as you identify them at any point in our development process (and not just when they enter the testing phase).        We Build for Scale:  You are expected to ensure that we are building for scale. We avoid tech debt and build things correctly the first time, in a way that will be maintainable and grow with us. Although there are always tradeoffs between timelines and features, we make deliberate decisions about these trade-offs and expect both our software and quality engineers to be a core part of that conversation.        We Collaborate:  As part of a larger team, you will work closely with peers and leadership to identify and solve problems. We are a remote, distributed team, so clear communication and active engagement in meetings is crucial. Your feedback, regardless of level or experience, is expected and welcome.        We Demonstrate Operational Excellence:  Your role as a quality engineer includes ensuring that the features we release will run smoothly and correctly. Knowing that issues inevitably will arise, you help us prepare by writing meaningful tests, clear documentation, and easy-to-follow troubleshooting guides. We own problems as they arise and see them through to resolution. When we solve problems, we identify the root cause and fix them for good.        We Innovate:  As a quality engineer on the team, you have a unique insight into what is possible. We always look for opportunities to innovate and improve our process and our tech.        We Treat Each Other With Respect:  We assume everyone is doing their best and treat everyone with respect. We expect people to have strong opinions, loosely held. This means that although you should always bring your honest and thoughtful opinions, recommendations, and experience to the table, we expect everyone to be willing to change their opinion based on new information and respect decisions.      Qualifications      5+ years experience working as automation engineer working in an agile SDLC.      5+ years experience working with UI based automated testing frameworks.      3+ years experience working with API automated testing frameworks such as karate and experience with manual API testing using Postman.      2+ years experience working with database testing.      1+ years experience working with CI/CD builds and deployments using tools such as GitLab.      Ability to organize your own work and operate independently.      Demonstrated problem solving and troubleshooting skills.      Experience in working collaboratively with a team of peer engineers and collaborators      Ability to troubleshoot and discover the root cause of problems in a Production environment      An understanding of networking, request/response, and REST APIs      Experience working in an Agile team/development environment (working with stakeholders and peers to plan and deliver the most impactful features as we experiment and learn).        Preferred:    Experience working in a CI/CD environment      Understanding and experience in Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS cloud services      Need help finding the right job?      We can recommend jobs specifically for you!      Job Locations US-TN-Memphis | US-TX-Austin | US-CT-Hartford      ID 2022-2744      Category Engineering      Type Full Time      Company AHS American Home Shield Corp

Basic Qualifications         A desire to work in a collaborative, intellectually curious environment     Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field or 3+ years industry experience     Coding expertise in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc.)     Expert coding in Python, R, VBA, or other automation-focused languages     Demonstrated experience with statistics (correlations, multivariate regressions, causal analysis, etc.)     Demonstrated experience with predictive analytics, machine learning or artificial intelligence     Expert coding in database and statistical software and methods (SQL, R, Stata, etc.)     Experience building interactive web applications from R with R Shiny     Expertise in data management and data storage principles     Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing     Data Warehousing Experience with Oracle, Redshift, PostgreSQL, etc.     Experience working with AWS big data technologies (Redshift, S3, EMR, EC2, Glue, etc.)     Query performance tuning skills     Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, influence business decisions, and complete root cause analyses     Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a team     Job summary   Job Description   The Amazon Customer Excellence System Team (ACES) has an immediate need for a creative and driven business intelligence engineer (BIE) with a passion for building systems that have a measurable impact. The right candidate will be innovative and technically versatile.      As a BIE, you should be an expert in the architecture of data warehouse solutions for the enterprise using multiple platforms. You should excel in the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. Excellent business and communication skills are required to work with business analysts and data engineers to determine how best to design reporting and analytics data systems.        Responsibilities include:          Optimizing the performance of business-critical queries and dealing with ETL job-related issues     Gathering and understanding data requirements, working with the team to achieve high quality data ingestion and building systems that can process, transform, and store the data in various relational and non-relational stores     Dive deeply into technical details (e.g., key dependencies, design choices, operability, etc.) with engineering teams and drive constructive technical discussions. Extracting and combining data from various heterogeneous data sources     Build and evaluate end-to-end designs for strengths and weaknesses (quality, scalability, latency, security, performance, data integrity, etc.). Correctly discerns concerning decisions that should prompt additional review     Write clear documentation, architecture documents and create an engineering roadmap     Exploring and learning the latest AWS technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiency     Members of this team will be challenged to innovate use the latest big data techniques. We are looking for people who are motivated by thinking big, moving fast, and exploring business insights. If you are autonomous and love to implement solutions to complex problems while working hard, having fun, and making history, this may be the opportunity for you.            Preferred Qualifications     Knowledge of distributed systems as it pertains to data storage and computing     Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing     Proven success in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe data modeling decisions and data engineering strategy     Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other BIEs for best practices     Demonstrated strength in software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations     Experience designing experiments     Experience using SageMaker to prepare, build, train, and deploy machine learning models     Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma methodologies     AWS certifications     5+ years industry experience     Master’s degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, or an equivalent quantitative field     Ability to work on a diverse team or with a diverse range of coworkers     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

We are seeking at  Data Scientist - Ads Optimization for a permanent full time position  ( remote).     As a Data Scientist in the SMB Ads Optimization team, your role is to design and build different mechanisms. We are looking for a mixture of statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer: someone who has passion for building and improving Internet-scale products informed by data.     Responsibilities          Conceptualize, analyze, build, test, and implement models that utilize various and diverse data sets to solve problems related to the employment and recruiting industries.      Build and implement machine learning models, testing frameworks, and visualizations to make timely decisions and influence the product roadmap.      Proactively research data and identify opportunities in the data to drive the product roadmap.      Evaluate data’s big picture to solve business problems rather than focusing on metrics alone/      Understand human behavior and know what to look for in the data.      Communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers, product managers, and other functions.      Understand and make sense of highly non-linear systems while figuring out how to optimize them      Helps identify ways to improve data quality and analysis. Utilizes a solid understanding of Indeed’s business fundamentals.         Qualifications         BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a closely related quantitative field.      3+ years of industry experience, with expertise in Data Science or Machine Learning engineering.      Expertise in statistical modeling and machine learning.      Strong ability to code in Python, Java, etc.      Expertise in applied machine learning, preferably in advertising, auctions, bidding or pricing systems      Experience running controlled online experiments and taking data-driven decisions for improving machine learning-based products. Preferably in non-independent settings, like marketplaces.      Can do small data modeling work: R, Python, Julia, Octave, Matlab      Can do big data modeling work: Hadoop, Pig, Scala, Spark      Can fish for data: SQL, Pandas, MongoDB      Can deploy data science solutions: Java, Python, C++             Salary Range       139,000 - 225,000 USD per year              Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance.      **The range listed is just one component of the total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include quarterly bonuses, Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), and an open Paid Time Off policy.          If qualified and interested, please send an updated resume to bonnie.kutin@comcentric.com          Bonnie Kutin     Recruiter     Comcentric Inc.         (805) 208-2137

job_title: Taxonomist & Information Architecture Strategist, Community Help & Education
job_Description: Community Product Operations plays a critical role in the product life cycle at the Facebook company—from ideation and development, to launch, growth, help, and support. We partner closely with product, engineering, data science and other Global Operations teams to improve the user experience and ensure that every product experience is safe, reliable, and supported at scale. Those who join our teams are very passionate about solving people's issues and are strong advocates for the Facebook community. We need influencers who can align cross-functional partners to ensure the best possible experience for our platforms.Meta is looking for a Taxonomist/Content Architecture specialist that will focus on the strategic planning, design, and implementation of taxonomies to help achieve goals of the Community Help & Education team, such as supporting the categorizing and labeling, machine learning and content understanding systems across all Meta's help products. The crux of this work is in developing, maintaining, growing a taxonomy for a number of complex, many-faceted products while integrating it across several organizations to drive reporting insights. The person in this role will be expected to be an experienced taxonomist able to quickly expand knowledge domains.This is a full time role.               Taxonomist & Information Architecture Strategist, Community Help & Education Responsibilities:           Make and help implement recommendations to continuously content performance and engagement.      Maintain and expand the foundational content and case management structure, including managing a complex taxonomy used to power content on the Facebook Help Center and various.      Support platforms, along with controlled vocabularies, dictionaries, keywords and more.      Bring in and drive the adoption of taxonomy and content management best practices.      Partner with the content team to evolve and improve content systems that promote performance, reuse, dynamic assembly, and distribution across multiple channels.      Collaborate with teams to define, conduct, and analyze rapid innovation experiments when needed.      Analyze ongoing quantitative and qualitative feedback and data from user interactions, such as search trends and entry-points, to identify trends and insights into user needs.      Coordinate discovery activities, gathering requirements and use cases, conducting audits and gap analyses, creating maps and matrices.      Contribute content strategy inputs to natural language processing and personalization.                   Minimum Qualifications:           5+ years of experience in developing taxonomies/or ontologies to support a variety of systems both for front-end and back-end use.      Bachelor’s degree in Library Science, Information Management, Linguistics, or another related field, or the equivalent in relevant experience.      Technical aptitude, familiarity with CMS (Content Management System) solutions and metadata-driven solutions like chatbots.      Experience with evaluating and implementing taxonomies to support systems such as search systems, content management systems, digital asset management systems, or product classification.      Experience building taxonomies for machine learning classification systems.      Superior communication and presentation skills, including experience communicating complex technical issues simply and convincingly to drive fast decisions.      Experience in improving and maintaining content management systems and taxonomies.      Highly experienced communicating and presenting taxonomy principles and standards.      Knowledge in delivering measurable outcomes through user experience                   Preferred Qualifications:           Experience with a scripting language such as Python or SQL. 2+ years of professional non-internship experience with front end, web or mobile software development using JavaScript, HTML and CSS     Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related technical discipline (or equivalent experience).     1+ years of professional front end development.     Skilled with common front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JS, TypeScript, and Node     Experience in one or more relevant front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, Thyme Leaf, JQuery, etc.     Job summary   AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Platform is the glue that holds the AWS ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, AWS Platform innovates with the customer in mind. The AWS Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.      The new AWS Accounts Console team simplifies the User Experience for AWS customers. We provide web-based experiences for customers to manage their root identity’s lifecycle (from account creation to account closure), their account preferences, and regional access to customer marketplace information. Our mission is to create extraordinary user interfaces.      As a Front End Engineer, you will develop improvements across multiple AWS consoles. You will work closely with a talented team of engineers, product managers, and UX designers to build browser-based user experiences that are easy to understand. You will also drive the operational excellence of the services owned by your team, including continuously improving the performance and security of the application.      Inclusive Team Culture   Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.      Work/Life Balance   Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.      Mentorship & Career Growth   Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.            Ability to rapidly prototype and adjust in response to customer feedback     Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.     Solid coding practices including peer code reviews, unit testing, and a preference for agile development.     Experience building scalable front-end infrastructure software or distributed systems for commercial online services.     Exposure to Front-end libraries/framework - React, Angular     Understands how to optimize the delivery of code and assets to a browser or device     Proficient in a broad range of software design approaches and common UX patterns. Knows when (and when not) to use front-end software design patterns     Demonstrated leadership abilities in an engineering environment in driving operational excellence and best practices.     Ability to decompose a problem into clear software and UX design actions.     Ability to articulate the benefits and challenges of depending on front-end libraries, frameworks, and tool-sets.     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Company:  LG Electronics N.A. Appliance Factory  Job Function:  Engineering   At LG we make products and services that make lives better, easier, and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make “Life Good”. From home appliances, consumer electronics, vehicle components, and mobile communications to business innovations in digital signage, air conditioning, solar and LED lighting. As a global leader, we strive for greatness in product leadership, market leadership and people leadership to realize our growth strategies.  Talk about a mantra. Life’s Good with LG! At LG, you're encouraged to take a creative and individual approach to challenges with a strong emphasis placed on performance and skill. That's why we deliver sure rewards for exceptional performance and offer industry-leading benefits. Come join the team!  We are seeking a qualified, innovative Production Engineer to join our growing organization. In this position, you will oversee and improve inspection machines in our Assembly Lines. Engineering aptitude, high attention to detail, and the ability to optimize processes for maximum efficiency are necessary skills for this role.   Responsibilities:  The Production Engineering Associate will be tasked with duties including, but not limited to:   Modify Equipment or Processes to maximize efficiency  Develop and draft new Inspection Processes  Prepare layouts for new process, select appropiate machinery, tools and equipment  Review and plan projects from concept review to installation and stabilization  Diagnose equipment breakdown and troubleshoot problems  Educate Employees on proper methods of machinery operation  Communicate with vendors to obtain materials and/or equipment needed to satisfy client's needs  Follow and adhere to all state, federal and company enforced safety rules   Qualifications/Skills:   0-2 years  Bachelors of Electrical Engineering/Manufacturing Engineering  Knowledge of systems, robotics, tools, equipment, etc.  Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel)  Experience with CAD Software  Knowledge of Computer or Machine Learning Techniques to build models  Excellent communication skills, both verbally and written  Ability to maintain positive vendor and client relationships   LG Electronics, USA Inc.; LG Mobilecomm USA, Inc., LG Mobile Research USA LLC, and Zenith Electronics LLC provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Job Title Business Process Management & Automation Specialist Job Description Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow. But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common: An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that makes a real difference – when it matters most. The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever-evolving health and well-being needs. The role of Business Process Management and Automation Manager is part of the Data Operations Team in Global Business Services for North America (GBS NAM). The Data Operations Team is responsible for improving data management utilization and accuracy across the value stream, enabling data-driven decision-making leveraging scaled data capabilities and driving productivity through end-to-end analyses for the GBS NAM functions: Financial Services, Supply Chain Management, HR/PPS, CFC – Commercial & Service, Campaign Management, Sleep & Respiratory, Service Operations, Proposal Management, Procurement, Transition Team, and Quality & Regulatory. In this role, you have the opportunity to Be responsible for overall management for Business Process Management team project activities including managing project deliverables, providing work assignments, coaching, and training to team members, and managing the project-related KPIs, SLAs, and reporting. This is a fast-paced role requiring the ability to motivate and lead a team, handle escalations, find solutions to complex problems, possess excellent communication and time-management skills along with utmost attention to detail. This role will interface with external customers as well as multiple business stakeholders. The position is responsible for working cross-functionally with business process owners, subject matter experts, and other business and technology stakeholders to discover, reengineer, and optimize business processes by identifying, empathizing, and solutioning continuous improvement opportunities through process engineering and intelligent automation initiatives and be consciously focused on driving value through revenue and cost impacts. This role continuously explores opportunities to improve processes and increase value add to the business; develop risk knowledge/expertise as necessary to engage/advise in the project and business decisions. You are responsible for the following (but limited to) Monitor and train team members on project-specific processes and requirements.  Create and maintain the project or initiative-specific work instructions and process documents.  Responsible for management and reporting of project KPIs and SLAs.  Collaborate with other teams to ensure project deliverables are met successfully.  Effectively set priorities with the team to meet workload, commitment, and all applicable team goals. Assist management with team updates and proactively communicate needed escalations for project risks. Support planned and ad-hoc data analysis efforts and issue resolution Analyze processes and show innovation in business process re-engineering related to reporting and analytics processes and data quality. Serve as the end to end Business Process Management knowledge expert from a data and system Ensure established processes comply with Philips’ Quality Standards of business conduct and followed Other duties and requirements as required Develop relationships with cross-functional teams to create customer-centric solutions that drive measurable results Utilize Lean, and project management to solve business problems and drive continuous improvements. Diagnose business processes, identify improvement opportunities, prescribe improvement strategies, and guide the improvement effort. Focus on efficiency improvements related to speed, quality, and simplification by eliminating rework loops, reducing and automating manual work and hand-offs, identifying and implementing best practices across the business, and minimizing process variability through standardization and automation. Lead the RPA and workflow automation (document, design, test, deploy) using recommended best practices Engage in discovery and identification of automation processes; proactively seek and suggest improvements, outline any risks and recommend optimal solutions Integrate automation workflows into existing business processes and business applications Consider the use of other automation platforms and technologies which can be implemented as part of Philips’ digital transformation Define, promote and utilize best practices for process automation capabilities. Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) for others seeking to utilize process automation technologies to automate and streamline existing manual business processes Work closely with the functional experts and RPA team to validate technical integration and development conforms to requirements Work with SMEs to ensure requirements are thorough and complete Prepare and present analysis, methods, and results to non-expert personnel, management team, and technical experts throughout different projects Makes decisions on complex and sensitive issues that are based on professional judgment, evaluating risks and in the context of a complex and changing environment You are a part of Philips is a global leader in health technology that makes life better for people, like you, through meaningful innovation. This position is a part of our Global Business Services group responsible for leading operational execution, reducing complexity, and increasing efficiencies as the in-house team that continuously improves performance to better support our customers. We are looking to expand our team in Nashville of passionate, inspirational, collaborative, and diverse professionals that are powering excellence around the world for Philips to achieve our mission to improve the lives of 3B people a year by 2025. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience 3+ years of working experience designing and deploying solutions to transform business processes and achieve business outcomes. RPA experience preferred. 3+ years managing a team focused on Business Process Management / Automation Relevant work experience in areas Customer Services, Process areas of Order Management, Service execution, and Service Operations is a must. Understanding of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Natural Language Processing is a plus SAP, Salesforce, Apttus, Workday, Anaplan experience a plus Experience developing a community of practice and self-learning tools Effective communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders to develop joint solutions Ability to influence and negotiate with others to deliver results Demonstrated accountability and ability to prioritize, think and solve problems Ability to be flexible, show initiative and respond quickly when situations change Candidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work in the US. In return, we offer you The unique combination of a critical and challenging role and a creative and empowering office environment. You will be actively encouraged to make improvements, establish best-in-class service, and have a direct impact on the success of Philips daily. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. Company:  FedEx Services       Job Title:  Revenue Science Advisor       Job Requisition Number:  RC511012       Category:  Decision Science & Analytics       Pay Type:  Exempt       Locations:     Collierville, Tennessee 38017    United States        Plano, Texas 75024    United States        Harrison, Arkansas 72601    United States        Lakeland, Florida 33801    United States        Brookfield, Wisconsin 53045    United States        Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15205    United States        Chalfont, Pennsylvania 18914    United States    Independently assumes lead roles in larger and higher revenue threshold projects. Key contributor to deriving business insights and analyzing business problems of high complexity. Generates computer aided quantitative and statistical business analysis by leveraging advanced tools and scientific modeling approaches related to customer analytics, market analysis and forecasting in support of the organization's global strategies.     Essential Duties/Responsibilities:         Assists in synthesizing analytical views reports and insights from various business dimensions in support of designing business strategies related to business plans, actual or forecast enterprise performance, products, channels, automation types, industry, competition, market and customer segments.        Reviews and optimizes go-to-market tactics related to specific target customers, markets and products in terms of marketing communication and sales calls.        Leads teams with peer partners from other groups.        Independently attends cross-functional meetings and discussions to provide business guidance based on analytical insights to peers and managers of partner teams.        Demonstrates excellence in computer aided decision support (utilize computer languages or packages to analyze data and generate reports, presentations or insights in business, mathematics, economics, computer science, or other quantitative field such as engineering/operations research), and programming languages (e.g. SAS, SQL, Python, C, VB.net, Java, JavaScript or R), relational databases (e.g. Teradata, Oracle) or visualizations tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Spotfire).        Mentors and trains professionals in less senior positions within the team on quantitative data analysis and utilization of above computer resources.        Provides updates, reports and analytical presentations to upper management across the enterprise.            Minimum Qualifications:             Master's Degree in business, mathematics, economics, computer science or other quantitative field such as engineering/operations research.        Three (3) years work experience required in business, mathematics, economics, computer science or other quantitative fields such as engineering/operations research, in an analytical, quantitative, or technical role.        Two (2) years of experience or coursework with the following skills (skills can be gained concurrently with education): computer aided decision support (utilize computer languages or packages to analyze data and generate reports, presentations or insights in business, mathematics, economics, computer science or other quantitative fields such as engineering/operations research), and programming languages (e.g. SAS, SQL, Python, C, VB.net, Java, JavaScript or R), relational databases (e.g. Teradata, Oracle) or visualizations tools (e.g. PowerBI, Tableau, Spotfire). Skills/knowledge/experience considered a plus for the role:             Expertise in developing solutions that enable data driven insight generation.        Broad experience in all aspects of data analysis including data engineering, wrangling, analytical modeling, presentation, and storytelling.        Strong skills in data science and machine learning methods. Experience with predictive modeling, prescriptive modeling, machine learning and deep learning based forecasting, big data processing, building and deploying machine learning models, and Azure or other cloud platforms.        Understanding of business concepts relevant to revenue management, marketing, and finance.        Experience in leading cross-functional teams to design and execute commercial strategy.        Strong intellectual curiosity, communication skills, and interpersonal skills.            Domicile:             This position is currently located in Memphis, Tennessee; however Plano, Texas; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Harrison, Arkansas; Brookfield, Wisconsin and Lakeland, Florida may also be considered.        Due to the collaborative nature of these roles, there is a strong desire to have the selected candidates located in one of the city/states above. These locations offers a hybrid work environment that supports in-person collaboration through onsite Team Days but allows team members flexibility to primarily work from home the rest of the time.            Remote Work Option:             Ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based upon business needs.            Relocation:             Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs.        ****Remote – State of Colorado       Compensation:     Monthly Salary: $10,342.06 - $13,383.84    The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range or starting rate of candidates hired in Colorado. Employee Benefits:  medical, dental, and vision insurance; paid Life and AD&D insurance; tuition reimbursement; paid sick leave; paid parental leave, paid vacation, paid military leave, and additional paid time off; geographic pay ranges; 401k with Company match and incentive bonus potential; sales Incentive compensation for selling roles. Market Manager LotLinx, the leading automotive AI-powered digital marketing tool, is experiencing tremendous growth and has an exciting opportunity for a  Market Manager  in our  Nashville, TN  market. LotLinx provides employees a dynamic work environment that is challenging, team-oriented, and full of passionate people. We offer great incentives to our employees, such as competitive compensation and benefits, flex time off, and career development opportunities. Role details The Market Manager is responsible for generating sales with new dealerships, increasing market penetration, and contributing revenue. They will work with client launch teams, sales development, account management, and LotLinx business partners. Uncover dealer pain points/sales opportunities Align LotLinx’s solutions to the dealer’s business needs Build consensus on a proposal and secure an agreement to work together Ensure dealer activation and smoothly transition the relationship to account management Build and work a sales pipeline Meet activity and revenue targets Additional projects as needed What You’ll Be Doing Day to Day Primary responsibility is to build & maintain influential relationships with customers and dealers by creating demand for LotLinx products by proactively offering solutions. Key areas of responsibility are: Demand Creation: Focus on technical needs of complex, emerging, or underpenetrated prospects. With a fundamental understanding of all of LotLinx’s solutions you will be able to match those solutions to customer business needs. Will drive/create new opportunities and product selection within assigned accounts, and create demand activity using other technical resources, as needed. Account Management: Create selling opportunities through a planned discovery process. Gain solid understanding of customer’s needs and how to translate those needs into LotLinx products. Execute on solution selling through a working knowledge of solutions and design processes. Grow profit and maximize margins by selling value-added, long-term solutions, with emphasis on demand creation and engineering. Relationships: Drive dealership relationships at multiple levels. Grow market share and sales. What We Are Looking For Requires in-depth knowledge and experience of automotive industry and dealerships Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective using existing solutions Works independently; receives minimal guidance Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience Represents the level at which career may stabilize for many years or even until retirement Uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products/services or processes Typically resolves complex problems or problems where precedent may not exist Works independently Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 5+ years of sales experience preferred Experience with presentation tools, Salesforce, and Outreach Proven track record of sales success Experience in the automotive industry is required Existing in-market dealer relationships highly preferred Competencies Communicative and high energy Self-motivated and ambitious Well-organized – able to multitask and manage time wisely Team player Able to work under pressure Revenue-focused Customer-focused About Us LotLinx is the best in class, AI-powered digital advertising solution for the automotive industry, and Chicago’s fastest growing company in 2018 as awarded by Crain’s Chicago Business. LotLinx uses advanced machine learning technology to help vehicle sellers analyze shopper data, identify high intent purchasers, and execute inventory-specific digital advertising campaigns.

job_title: Member of Technical Staff - Opportunity for Working Remotely Nashville, TN
job_Description: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?     Cloud technology is changing fast, and cloud management and operations is changing even faster! Major enterprises, financial institutions, governments, schools, universities, and healthcare providers need new technology to help them rapidly leverage multi-cloud and hybrid cloud deployments. VMware is driving this transformation for 350,000 customers, including 98% of the Fortune 500. You won’t find another company that offers the same breadth of innovative technology. Now imagine the opportunity to make it simpler to manage private, hybrid, and multi-cloud environments to run traditional and cloud-native apps across any cloud using VMware’s cutting-edge technologies. You will work with the latest technology stacks to build platforms and domain-specific use cases at humungous scale. This opportunity provides rich possibilities to learn, grow and flourish as an engineer.     This engineer role will be a member of the vRealize Network Insight (vRNI) team, which is part of the Modern Application and Management Business Group. In vRNI, we are transforming management, operations, and security for the Software Defined Data Center (SDDC). This platform helps IT organizations plan, operate, visualize, analyze, and fix their complex software-defined data center and cloud environments. The product, built on advanced technology pioneered by startups Arkin and Veriflow, has won numerous industry awards including Gartner Cool Vendor. Our team is building a large scale distributed real time operations and analytics platform with enterprise grade reliability. You get to work with a talented team of peers in the domains of networking and security, distributed systems, data analytics pipelines, ML and AI, REST APIs, and user interfaces delivering insights from complex data. We are involved in every aspect of the product development process, from early feature concept design to product development to testing and validation at customer sites. The team culture encourages innovation, with opportunities to file patents, write research papers and participate in hackathons.     If you have the drive to work on the next big thing in cloud management and operations, we would love to talk!     What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?     The following is a schedule for the first year of joining:         Within 15 days of employment, become competent with VMware’s rules, guidelines and standard operating procedures. Go through the new hire orientation and trainings.      Within 1 month of employment, get hands-on with the product and its use-cases.      Within 3 months of employment, learn the product area assigned to you in detail, the technology stack in use, become familiar with the project and features in the assigned domain, and get accustomed to the code base, release cycles etc.      Within 6 months of employment, work towards becoming competent in coding and functional dev testing of the product.      Within 1 year of employment, work towards becoming competent in handling engineering design, coding, reviews, functional automation of dev test of the products feature. [GB1]           What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?     As a software development engineer, you will:         Work as a member of a back-end team developing novel distributed systems and algorithms for near-real-time analysis of large-scale cloud networks and software-defined data centers.      Research, design and implement industry best practices to provision, maintain and monitor cloud environments.      Work on product feature engineering design, coding, review, testing, automation, and debugging.      Collaborate with back-end, front-end, and platform infrastructure teams, as well as product managers, customers, and support, to create an optimized and usable platform.      Work closely with a team of passionate people with a startup mindset and who want to change the status quo.      Work with teams across multiple sites and geographies as a collaborator and partner.      Have a customer focus to ensure high quality solutions are delivered which meet the expectations of our customers and be able to work with other customer-facing teams to ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction.      Plan the scope of complex, large features which may span across multiple teams and be delivered in multiple release cycles.      Operate with a service ownership mindset to work in a DevOps mode where the dev team is responsible for all automation, quality, CI/CD, logging, and monitoring of services that are being built.      Work in a fast-paced environment where priorities and direction may change rapidly to keep pace with customer requirements and market directions.           As a software development engineer, you will:         Work as a member of a back-end team developing novel systems for near-real-time analysis of large-scale cloud networks and software-defined data centers.      Research, design and implement industry best practices to provision, maintain and monitor cloud environments.      Work on product feature engineering design, coding, review, testing, automation, and debugging.      Collaborate with back-end, front-end, and platform infrastructure teams, as well as product managers, customers, and support, to create an optimized and usable platform.      Work closely with a team of passionate people with a startup mindset and who want to change the status quo.      Work with teams across multiple sites and geographies as a collaborator and partner.      Have a customer focus to ensure high quality solutions are delivered which meet the expectations of our customers and be able to work with other customer-facing teams to ensure the highest levels of customer satisfaction.      Plan the scope of complex, large features which may span across multiple teams and be delivered in multiple release cycles.      Operate with a service ownership mindset to work in a DevOps mode where the dev team is responsible for all automation, quality, CI/CD, logging, and monitoring of services that are being built.      Work in a fast-paced environment where priorities and direction may change rapidly to keep pace with customer requirements and market directions.           Required Qualifications         You are fluent in back-end software development with Java.  You are familiar with the use of common open source software packages.      You have clear, concise communication skills to articulate your thought process, design tradeoffs, and decisions to a team of highly technical individuals.      You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.      You adopt a "whatever it takes" attitude and work effectively both within the immediate team and across teams.           Desired Qualifications         You have an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent.      You have experience with distributed systems, networking, algorithms, or machine learning.      You are familiar with cloud computing technologies and data center concepts such as infrastructure as code, virtualization, networking, and security.      You are familiar with agile/SCRUM development methodologies.      You are passionate about the quality of your code and understand test-driven development and unit testing.           What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?     The vRealize Network Insight team came to VMware through the acquisition of a startup, and grew organically from a small group to a 100+ person engineering team. It’s a fast-paced and innovative environment where the team works with co-founders to accomplish the vision. The team is built on trust and empathy, and we celebrate each other’s successes. vRNI is headed by Shiv Agarwal, who is the Vice President and GM of the group, and is based in Palo Alto, California. The engineering team is distributed across India and the U.S. In this role, you will be joining the U.S.-based team.     The leadership encourages independent thinking and gives a free hand to innovate. We have a diverse, inclusive and open culture in the team. We encourage continuous learning, sharing of ideas and thoughts, and growing together as a team. The team consists of engineers, architects, UX designers and product managers, with experience ranging from less than a year to more than 20 years.        Where is the role located?     This role is based in the U.S. Our offices are in Palo Alto, CA. There is an option to work remotely.        What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?     You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights.         Employee Stock Purchase Plan      Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types      Generous Time Off Programs      40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community      Financial contributions to your personal/career development (conference participation, trainings, course work, certifications etc.)      Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes           This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry. Category :  Engineering and Technology   Subcategory:  Software Engineering   Experience:  Manager and Professional   Full Time/ Part Time:  Full Time   Posted Date:  2022-04-01  Simplifying the experience of managing and optimizing complex cloud environments. That’s how the CloudHealth team is making VMware’s ‘any cloud’ mantra a reality for leading enterprise businesses around the world. Our customers don’t just gain tighter control over their cloud spend and security – they’re freeing up time and money for high-impact business initiatives, easing the resource burden for their time-strapped IT teams, and driving tighter collaboration with their Finance colleagues. We’re here helping the people behind organizations embark on cloud transformation journeys; all while transforming and growing their Cloud Centers of Excellence. Come join us if you want to make your unique mark on the rapidly evolving, never dull, cloud technology market. We’re an agile, collaborative, and customer-centric team with the mentality of a fast-growing startup and the support of an industry-leading, 30,000+ employee technology company beside us.        VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
