Major Duties/Responsibilities You will be responsible for leading, conducting, coordinating, and reporting complex research assignments related to buildings, specifically: (1) building energy modeling using EnergyPlus and OpenStudio; (2) assessments for energy efficiency in support of the Weatherization Office; and (3) building components and systems analysis for energy efficiency. Your work will involve interacting and collaborating with researchers from universities, national laboratories, and private industry. You will have the opportunity to interface directly with program sponsors and lead proposal development teams.  The selected candidate will:   Assist in the design, development, implementation, and testing of OpenStudio/EnergyPlus models to simulate energy use for single-family manufactured homes, and mobile homes.  Evaluate approved retrofit measures for the Weatherization Program and write code to implement them.  Write code with interoperability of measures in mind to support the Weatherization Program.  Implement economic calculations to enable comparison of measures and prioritize based on energy and cost savings to investment ratios.  Qualifications Required  The position requires:   A master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline or a bachelor’s degree with a minimum of two years of relevant experience.  Significant experience with OpenStudio/EnergyPlus, expertise in software programming, and knowledge of building physics are required. Additional experience with machine learning, urban-scale building energy modeling, high-performance computing, statistics, workflow automation, or leveraging modern software libraries is strongly preferred.  Ability to develop and/or maintain strong relationships through active participation in building industry organizations and events.  Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills to support team building, partnering, and regular interactions with sponsors, states, local weatherization agencies, and others.  Excellent written communication skills to collaborate on reports, proposals, publications, and journal articles.  The demonstrated ability to meet project schedules, scopes, and budgets.  Moderate experience with Python, Ruby, or C++ for the purpose of energy simulations.  No security clearance is required for this position.

job_title: Speaker Identification Engineer (Speech to Text Startup)
job_Description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. About our Client Join our client in transforming the way remote teams work and communicate. Their AI-powered collaborative note-taking app works across Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams to help teams record, transcribe, search and share meeting notes. In addition, we are making virtual meetings accessible to all employees - allowing team members with disabilities to participate in a world that is now dominated by virtual meetings. With over 10M users experiencing their product, they are making an impact at scale and we are growing fast. The team is made up of top talent from companies like Google, Facebook, Yahoo!, Microsoft, Pinterest, Spotify, and Plaid. They are backed by leading investors that include David Cheriton (Google’s first investor), Tim Draper ( Draper Associates ), Spectrum Equity, Horizons Ventures, GGV Capital, and Duke University. About this role Our client is seeking an experienced Speaker Identification Engineer (Junior | Senior | Staff) to join our technology team and solve challenging technical problems in processing collaborative voice conversations. Members of the technology team work as a group and with colleagues in engineering and product to devise and deploy new algorithms for speech recognition, speaker diarization, and recognition. Qualifications M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent Strong programming skills with working knowledge of C++ and Python 1-3 years of experience working on DNN based speaker id and diarization system Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks Experience working in a Linux environment Team player with good communication skills (oral and written)Qualifications Preferred Qualifications Ph.D. in Computer Science, Speech/Language Processing or Machine Learning Familiarity with the state of the art in deep learning Experience with end-to-end neural network based speaker recognition Experience with MapReduce, Spark, or similar frameworks Experience building crawlers Experience administering Linux clusters Experience developing web applications Employee Benefits Stock. Be a [literal] stakeholder in our company’s future.  Food. Enjoy catered meals and boundless snacks. Fun. We host team lunches weekly and team events bi-quarterly. People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do. Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance. Base Salary Range 150K-230K

Medalogix is a one-of-a-kind data analytics company in the post-acute care space. We are transforming home health and hospice agencies by leveraging cutting-edge data science, machine learning, and innovative cloud technology to equip clinicians and agencies to provide the right care at the right time.     The Company's five machine learning products have demonstrated improved patient outcomes and reduced cost to the healthcare system, including reduced hospitalization, appropriate and timely transitions to end-of-life care, and optimized visit utilization for patients. Medalogix is poised for tremendous growth, as skilled home health and hospice care are positioned as the lowest cost providers in an industry shifting to value-based care.     Medalogix is currently seeking a hungry, humble, and smart Integration & Application Support Engineer to join our technology innovators that are bringing home health and hospice to the next level. We are proud to share that we have recently earned our Great Place to Work Certification, affirming our commitment to do the right thing.     Why Medalogix?     High growth & awesome culture  – Medalogix has grown 100%+ for three straight years, with continued material growth planned over the next three years. This success is achieved through passionate, high-functioning talent focused on success. We work hard through our core virtues: Be Badass, Dream Big/Act Small, Do No Harm, and Row Together.     Meaningful work  – Our products are used by healthcare providers in their day-to-day care programs. Our company’s work directly impacts patient care in the home.     Modern technology products  – At the core Medalogix is a technology company. We build modern, cloud-based SaaS software underpinned by data science and data engineering. Our technology team is passionate about using leading tools and practices in our daily work. We build market-leading products that delight our customers. Medalogix products have received recognition from The Boston Globe, Fierce Healthcare, Becker's Hospital Review, HIMSS, and Harvard Business Review.     Competitive compensation & benefits  – Medalogix provides big company benefits in a smaller company environment. We provide competitive compensation along with awesome benefits including 401(k) matching.     Role Overview     The Integration & Application Support Engineer is responsible for the care and feeding of the production environment with a strong focus on data ingestion. Reporting to the leader of support, this position will initially focus on the manual resolution of production issues while evolving into a proactive approach to the health of our platforms. This person will have a strong interaction with development, devops, and security to prepare for future delivery of capabilities with a focus on supportability. A great candidate will bring passion and discipline for managing the health of production systems.        A successful candidate will keep production applications healthy and functioning appropriately. They will ensure data feeds from customers are active. They will have elevated the company’s maturity in that builds on our great culture today.     Requirements         Monitoring & support of production business applications      Support of data ingestion process ensuring healthy data flow and the ability for customers to make critical clinical decisions      Onboard new customer data feeds      Create proactive solutions for monitoring & detecting potential issues, ultimately resolving an issue before it impacts the business & customers      Collaborate with engineering to get necessary platform enhancements for support & operations      Interact and communicate with customer technology teams as needed      Participate in on-call rotations      Support and enhance our collaborative and innovative team culture that spans the organization      Mentor, challenge, and grow your peers on the Medalogix technology team        What would make you a strong fit for the role         Strong desire & willingness to develop new skillsets and improve support processes      Technical skills include: Windows Server, Linux, scripting, SQL      Previous technical support experience potentially including system admin/support, network support, technical help desk, and other relevant experience      Willingness to work in a highly collaborative, team based culture        Benefits         Highly sponsored Health insurance with HSA and FSA option      Optional Dental and Vision insurance      401(k) company match      Education Assistance Program/Employee Assistance Program      We celebrate our wins with team events/outings      Generous Paid Time Off + Eight Paid Holidays      Free downtown parking      Discounted in-building gym

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.      If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.      Our Client      Our client started with an observation: In a world full of applications, why do documents and spreadsheets still run everything? And why haven't they been meaningfully updated in over 50 years? Their product is a new doc that's familiar and flexible like the documents you're used to, but comes with building blocks you can combine to create docs as powerful as apps. It's a big product with an even bigger mission. And they need your help to spread the word! They are backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists and have assembled a world-class team across offices in San Francisco, Mountain View, and Seattle, and remote employees all over the US. In fact, all their jobs are open in any location across the US.            Role Overview                 Our client is looking for a Growth Product Manager to focus on increasing awareness, user base, their usage of the product, and their retention. You will work on features from SEO/SEM systems for lead generation, Machine Learning for Ads targeting, incentives for users to upgrade to our paid plans, new user experience, and retention. You'll be enthusiastically metrics-focused while driving creative product changes to improve our platform.        Our client's Product Managers have a diverse roles. That means working with Engineers, Designers, and our Go-to-Market teams to understand their customers' needs and build a simple yet powerful product. Our client is used by tens of thousands of people and they're still early in their journey. Joining the small PM team early means your fingerprints will be all over the foundation of the product and its growth. You will report to one of our three PM leads.        In this role you will:               Help set product strategy and lead teams across multiple functions to provide for our customers         Work with Data Science and Marketing to understand what's working and not, and why         Work with Design and Engineering counterparts to learn with customers and ship improvements         Examine the details of our growth looks, and find opportunities to create metrics. Validate through high-velocity experimentation and refinement         Be a thoughtful team leader and help make your teammates better         Help direct and conduct customer research and distill analyses to aid product strategy         Be the voice of the customer or promote others voicing customer needs in product discussions              You may be a great fit for this role if:               Have experience driving product improvements by using all types of learning: user testing, data analysis, A/B testing         Have experience delivering step changes in metrics through incremental and step change product changes         Enjoy expressing multiple points of view and facilitating decisions         Balance design and technical tradeoffs and find creative ways of solving customer needs         Have experience showcasing an "eye for design" ー building beautiful, simple user experiences in collaboration with designers         Enthusiasm, curiosity, a desire to listen and understand customers         Care about teammates and uplift and improve the team and the team's culture         Have 5+ years of experience                           Benefits:  PTO, Health Benefits, and More!                    Base Salary Range:  $100,000 to $200,000

Job Description:         Title:  DevOps Engineer, Vulnerability Management & Security Development           Location:  Nashville, TN              The Vulnerability Management program is a core component of Asurion’s security capabilities. The mission is to deliver and maintain a central location to store and review all vulnerabilities, to optimize remediation efforts based on the risk to Asurion, and to continually integrate new data sources, risk models, engagement with interna customers and improve based on feedback.              The Security Development team integrates a broad range of software security tools (SAST, SCA, DAST, etc.), both commercial and custom built, and paves the road for internal customers. Automation and high availability are critical, as well as the empathy for developers’ and DevOps engineer’s ever-expanding responsibilities. Providing simple, but effective solutions is critical to enterprise success.              The DevOps Engineer role will contribute to the administration and continuous improvement of the software security and vulnerability management tools used by Asurion’s global enterprise. They will be expected to partner with teams throughout the global organization to assist with onboarding them into the tools and collecting feedback on the user experience.              The candidate must have experience with working as a team to develop coding projects, with experience in Python and Groovy being preferred. A candidate should have experience working with APIs to extract and input data as part of integrating and automating processes. They must be comfortable engaging with team members in a global environment with empathy and clear communication.              Essential duties and responsibilities:            Administration and enhancement of our software security and vulnerability management tools, empowering teams to maintain the security of Asurion.      Collaborate with teams throughout the global enterprise to better understand their needs, then translate that into extensions or customizations of our existing capabilities.      Design, develop, deploy, and support custom enterprise tools using AWS, Azure, and other cloud technologies.      Perform internal consulting to assist journey teams in adopting best practices for their enterprise applications.               Here’s what you’ll bring to the team:            2+ years of experience in DevOps Engineering and CI/CD technologies and processes      2+ years of experience with Python, Groovy, Node.js, or Java      2+ years hands-on experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google      2+ years practical experience with code release management, deployment automation tools, and CI/CD pipelines; past work with Jenkins, Artifactory, Atlassian Jira, and Git repositories are all plusses      Demonstrated ability to build positive relationships across teams, preferably in a global enterprise environment      The perseverance to drive hard problems to resolution under supervised guidance      Strong sense of ownership over your work      Experience with SIEM tools, machine learning technologies and/or penetration testing a plus      The ability and the desire to learn new technologies quickly      Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or related field

Why CCI?  CCI Systems, Inc. is an Employee-Owned solution provider specializing in telecommunications, comprehensive network assessments, industry-leading engineering, drafting and design services, and 24/7 support services. Our outstanding team-based work culture and environment has allowed us to grow, develop, and retain long-term employees. We value our employee’s hard work and determination and REWARD results all while having fun!      Our mission  is to make life better by connecting people through innovative communication systems.      We are seeking   a  Data Science Manager  to provide leadership and coaching for the Data Science team and act as a liaison for the business unit and project stakeholders. You will provide expert support and development to the data science environment through knowledge and experience of data model creation, machine learning, analytics, and automation. This key working management position works within the IT team to provide effective leadership and support in coordinating IT resources to achieve and maintain optimally performing data solutions to meet the needs of the enterprise. You will incorporate industry best practices and concepts in the design of data solutions and models that solve business challenges and optimize efficiency, visibility into data, and capability to scale as the company grows.          Responsibilities           In collaboration with senior management, determine all budgetary needs as they relate to you and your direct reports and your systems.       Ensure team and system observance of all development, security, and compliance standards.       Manage support tickets and ensure end user satisfaction while resolving incidents.       Lead and participate in requirements gathering, prioritization, and peer review to facilitate execution of standard development processes.       Architect, develop, and maintain technical tools and platforms needed to accomplish data science initiatives.       Design and develop data models to achieve business objectives including machine learning, predictive analytics, and automation.       Adjust, monitor, and maintain data models.       Provide technical and architectural oversight for assigned projects.       Understand potential performance impacts of system changes and help to ensure performance is maximized.       Participate as an expert resource in process improvement and automation initiatives.       Work closely with IT and Business Management to identify new potential solutions to streamline processes, reduce cost, and increase revenue generation.       Participate in requirements definition, analysis, and implementation of new data science deliverables.       Publish and communicate security and governance compliance with IT and business units.       Create and promote the company image through exercising sound and ethical business practices as related to employees, the public and customers. This includes ensuring that service and quality provided to customers is superior to that of our competition.       Ensure confidentiality of company information.       Perform other related duties as assigned by management.              Required skills we are looking for           Bachelor’s degree in mathmatics, data science/analytics, or computer science is required; Master’s degree in data science preferred.       5+ years’ experience working in a Data Science role with 2+ years in a lead/principal role required.       Experience building a data science program from scratch is preferred.       Experience selecting and implementing software and systems to facilitate data science initiatives and solutions is preferred.       Practical experience of data architecture concepts and best practices.       Practical experience working with relational databases and SQL.       Practical experience working with unstructured datasets.       Experience working with data analysis tools and languages such: Python, R, TensorFlow, and Hadoop.       Excellent computer skills including the use of Microsoft Office and various web-based applications.       Strong problem solving and creative solution development skills.       Proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is crucial.       Effectively work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential.       Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills and ability to interface & communicate professionally.       Willingness to learn, adapt and accept increased responsibility.       Highly responsible, resourceful, accurate, dependable, and self-motivated.       Leadership with skills to positively influence others, collaborate with teammates, communicate on the level of others, listen, and understand people in circumstances common in the workplace.       The ability to embrace corporate values, understands the company mission, and exemplifies CCI leadership behaviors.              Shift is  Monday-Friday between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. CST and must be able to work outside normal business hours when required.

Excellent stakeholder management with strong leadership skills to influence, persuade and negotiate.     Hands-on experience in writing and tuning SQL queries.     Strong understanding of data engineering, ETL processes as well as data lake and data warehouse concepts.     Understanding of Advanced analytics using statistical modelling and machine learning models is a big plus     Hands on experience in creating PowerBI, Tableau, and/or SAP Business Objects dashboards, or experience in other visualization tool is a big plus.     Coding in Java, Python, R or any other object-oriented language is a big plus.     Previous experience in a ML or data scientist role and a track record of building ML or DL models is a big plus.       Competencies:          Business Acumen     Organizational Agility     Comfort Around Senior Management     Customer Focus     Priority Setting     Innovation Management     Decision Quality     Dealing with Ambiguity     Drive for Results     Global Agility     Building Effective Teams     Managing Diversity     Developing Direct Reports     Functional/Technical Skills     Learning on the Fly     Self-Development     Sylvamo is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.      If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.      Our Client      Our client started with an observation: In a world full of applications, why do documents and spreadsheets still run everything? And why haven't they been meaningfully updated in over 50 years? Their product is a new doc that's familiar and flexible like the documents you're used to, but comes with building blocks you can combine to create docs as powerful as apps. It's a big product with an even bigger mission. And they need your help to spread the word! They are backed by some of the Valley's leading venture capitalists, and have assembled a world-class team across offices in San Francisco, Mountain View, and Seattle, and remote employees all over the US. In fact, all their jobs are open in any location across the US. Here's a quick overview of what they do.            Role Overview                       As a growth engineer, you will increase our user base, their usage of the product, and their retention. You will work on features from SEO/SEM for lead generation, incentives for users to upgrade to our paid plans, new user experience, and retention. You will work with a stellar team of passionate, experienced engineers, data scientists, and product managers who have been instrumental in building some of the most widely-used technology products in the world, including YouTube, Google Drive/Docs, Google Shopping/Travel, Amazon AWS, Pinterest, and Microsoft Azure. You will report to one of three managers on our small, close-knit teams.                   Their application runs on React, TypeScript, Python, NodeJS, and sklearn and runs on Kubernetes in Amazon AWS. Their data stack uses Snowflake and Mode Analytics for dashboards.
